slides.body:
Who are you?

This is the application for the Babel Between Us project. If you have not read the introduction to the project, you should do so before applying.

We ask you to pick a pseudonym as the project is anonymous at the start. This pseudonym will be your username throughout the project.

All information in the application will only be available to the Babel Between Us team, unless otherwise stated.

slides.title: Writing sample one
slides.body:
Write something from scratch. (Less than 2000 characters)

This contribution will be posted under your pseudonym on the Babel Between Us platform and will be available for the world to read.

slides.title: Writing sample two
slides.body:
The text to the left is a random contribution from another applicant. Respond to or continue this text with a contribution of your own. Evaluators will see which text you have responded to, so don't change it once you have chosen one to work with. There is no guidelines apart from the following the “yes, and” principle. Do as you wish with the fiction. (Less than 2000 characters)

This contribution will be posted under your pseudonym on the Babel Between Us platform and will be available for the world to read.

slides.title: About your work schedule

diagram.alt: Drawing by Sune Skote, showing people running towards a creature

slides.body: How will you manage this project with your current schedule and commitments? (Less than 1000 characters)

slides.title: About you and your data
slides.instructions:
We will ask selected writers to contribute to a collaborative body of work. After the writing is concluded, we will use the co-created fiction in an interactive presentation. By submitting this form, you are agreeing to release your two writing samples under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 license.

All content in the Babel Between Us project is released under the same license. Read more about the intellectual property policies of the project here.
slides.body: These questions will be used to register an account for you on bbu.world. You keep your account regardless if you are selected as one of the writers and can stay in touch with us and follow the project. Your writing samples will be published there under your pseudonym, but the rest of the information in the application will only be available to the Babel Between Us team.

fields.name: consent
fields.placeholder: I understand that submitting this form will create an account for me an Edgeryders Communities account on bbu.world, and that my responses to the two writing samples will be posted under my chosen pseudonym and released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 license.
fields.error: Please consent to the terms and conditions

slides.title: Thank you!
slides.body: Thank you for taking the time to apply to Babel Between Us. You will receive an email from Edgeryders to activate your account at bbu.world and Edgeryders Communities. If you have any questions contact us on our forum bbu.world where you now have an account, or on team@bbu.world or twitter.
